author: Eric in TX

review: I like the FireTV overall, yet the BIGGEST DETRACTOR for me is trying to use it to watch content via Hulu.  Frequently when watching a show, the screen will freeze while the audio continues.  The picture returns sometimes after a minute or two, sometimes never.  I have to try and go back to a point where it synched video and audio.  HOWEVER, there is neveer a problem when viewing commercials.  It is as though the commercial always get preferential treatment while the normal video is "what the heck, try to show it but give up if i cant do it easily."Another problem this day and age is trying to find someone involved with the product who really cares about things such as this.  Most times, they shrug their shoulders and say there is nothing they can do.  BULL DOGGIES!  Care about the product you support, otherwise your product will tank,
author: K. Welty

review: I really wanted to like the FireTV, its a great concept but poorly executed and supported.  My biggest complaint for the week and a half I had it was that unfortunately too few apps are supported and what is supported are older versions that are very limited in features.The hardware itself is very nice, the setup process was little over simplified.  Those of us who are technically don't really want to sit through a long video or step by step setup process.I ended up returning the product.  I really hope it matures and sticks around but for now I prefer my Chromecast dongles.
author: M. Mead "Yzerman"
